meanings.definition: Microorganisms that can cause disease or infection.
meanings.sent1: Wash your hands to get rid of germs.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study germs to understand how diseases spread.
meanings.sent3: The sneezing germs had a party in the classroom.
meanings.sent4: Fear spread through the town like germs in the air.
meanings.sent5: Germs are like invisible villains waiting to make you sick.

meanings.definition: A source of disease or infection.
meanings.sent1: Cover your mouth when you cough to prevent spreading germs.
meanings.sent2: The dirty doorknob was a hotspot for germs.
meanings.sent3: The salad dressing turned out to be a hidden treasure trove of germs.
meanings.sent4: Gossip can be like germs, spreading quickly and causing harm.
meanings.sent5: Avoid touching your face to keep germs away from entering your body.

meanings.sent1: Scientists use microscopes to study tiny germs.
meanings.sent2: The pond water was teeming with tiny germs.
meanings.sent3: The garden gnome had a secret collection of tiny germs.
meanings.sent4: Ideas can spread like germs, influencing many people.
meanings.sent5: In the world of germs, even the smallest can have a big impact.
